title: Bell Pepper Freshness Check

items.name: Fridge life
items.details: Green bell peppers last about a week in the fridge if stored properly.

items.name: Signs of going bad
items.details: Soft spots, wrinkles, shriveling, or mold indicate the pepper is past its prime.

items.name: Wrinkled but not moldy
items.details: Still safe to eat and usable for cooking, but will have lost crispness and flavor. Not good for eating raw.

items.name: Where mold appears
items.details: Usually starts on the outside as fuzzy spots or discoloration. Check inside after cutting open as well.

items.name: When to discard
items.details: If you see mold inside, strong off smell, or fuzzy patches, throw it out.

notes: A wrinkled pepper is still safe for cooking if not moldy, but won't have the best texture or flavor.
